Package ascii_processing

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • ascii_processing.Utils
  • public abstract class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
    Class with useful random methods.

    Note to self:
    Maybe make into an interface with default methods?
    Maybe move methods to Shape and make protected? I mean shapes are the only ones that use them atm (except for printPoints, but that can be worked around, and nothing uses it anymore, anyways.)

    • Method Detail

      • lineBetween

        public static final java.util.ArrayList<int[]> lineBetween​(int[] point1,
                                                           int[] point2)
        Makes a line between 2 points.

        Has exactly one point for every x coordinate. Does not include the ending point.

        Parameters:
        point1 - starting point
        point2 - ending point
        Returns:
        the line between the points
        See Also:
        straightLine(int[], int[])

      • straightLine

        public static final java.util.ArrayList<int[]> straightLine​(int[] point1,
                                                            int[] point2)
        Returns an ArrayList of the points on a vertical line.
        Parameters:
        point1 - starting point
        point2 - point with y coordinate to end by
        Returns:
        list of points on the vertical line
        See Also:
        lineBetween(int[], int[])

      • reversePoint

        public static final int[] reversePoint​(int[] point)
        Reverses a point's coordinates.

        For example, (x,y) becomes (y,x).

        Parameters:
        point - 2D point
        Returns:
        reversed point
        See Also:
        reversePoints(HashSet)

      • reversePoints

        public static final java.util.HashSet<int[]> reversePoints​(java.util.HashSet<int[]> points)
        Reverses the points of a HashSet.
        Parameters:
        points - set of points
        Returns:
        set of reversed points
        See Also:
        reversePoint(int[])

      • fillBorder

        public static final java.util.HashSet<int[]> fillBorder​(java.util.ArrayList<int[]> border)
        Finds all points within a border.

        The border must be ordered sequentially.

        Parameters:
        border - list of points on a border
        Returns:
        set of points within and including the border
        See Also:
        Polygon.makeBorder(int[][])

      • printPoints

        public static final void printPoints​(java.util.HashSet<int[]> points)
        Prints each point in a set, separated by newlines.

        Used for debugging.

        Parameters:
        points - points to print
